abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Education Project for the
            Ivory Coast had mixed results. Physical implementation of
            the project was generally good. Equipment and furniture are
            generally appropriate, although some unsuitable equipment
            has apparently been procured for the vocational training
            centers, perhaps because of a lack of consultation with
            employers on equipment lists. While both the vocational
            training centers and the project teacher training centers
            were fully staffed, adequately funded, and operating at
            capacity at the time of the completion mission, there is
            still a need to ensure that all such facilities,
            particularly those supported by the Bank, are properly used
            before further capacities are financed by the Bank. Finally,
            the pre-investment studies financed under the project have
            had little impact, as the operating ministries did not
            follow up the recommendations. Overall, the project has not
            fully achieved its main objectives. This report also
            inlcudes the Project Completion Report.

            International Development Association held on Tuesday, May

            Project for Ivory Coast.

17899940.subtopic: Education For All,Tertiary Education,Primary Education,Teaching and Learning,Access & Equity in Basic Education

education expenditures, education reform,

abstracts.cdata!:
The project consists of: (a)
            construction and equipping of two primary teacher training
            colleges at Abengourou and Gagnoa to provide one-year
            courses to 300 students at each college; (b) conversion and
            equipping of four urban vocational training centers in
            Abidjan, plus technical assistance to upgrade at least 750
            skilled workers per year for industry; (c) supplementary
            technical assistance for (i) continuing the secondary school
            inventory, begun under the first project, and carrying out
            an inventory of technical schools and (ii) managing and
            operating the instructional television scheme; (d)
            pre-investment studies for a third project focusing on (i)
            the education/training needs of regional development schemes
            in rural areas and (ii) the introduction of more practical
            instruction in secondary education; and (e) provision of
            three man-years of technical assistance and equipment for
            project administration.
